title.narrative: Lower Mekong Initiative (LMI) Air Conditioning Efficiency Project

description.narrative: The project aims to support Vietnam in its implementation of a national policy roadmap for air conditioners. title.narrative: Lower Mekong Initiative (LMI) Regional Working Meeting (non-travel)

description.narrative: Total costs not related to travel for LMI Regional Working Group Meetings. Building on the Busan Declaration for Aid Effectiveness, the LMI Working Groups, consisting of government officials from various ministries, will discuss project ideas and develop joint concepts that can be incorporated into our program development. The working groups meet in-region twice a year to determine new policy, coordinate program development with LMI regional partners, and update the joint action plan. In addition to covering venue and related administrative costs, funding will be used to cover costs of LMI partner country participants, including travel and lodging, ensuring that these governments can bring the necessary working and mid-level officials from various line ministries, and thereby emphasizing the whole-of-government partnership approach through LMI.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: The Bureau of Energy Resources (ENR) through the National Association of Regulatory Utility Commissioners (NARUC) will support the Lower Mekong Initiative (LMI) by conducting sequential regional technical workshops that will target power sector regulators or those with regulatory functions in LMI partner country governments. The workshops will focus on regulatory capacity development and market oversight with attention to regional integration. The first event will focus on introducing the participating commissioners, who are engaged in the regulation of utilities in one of the fifty States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, or the Virgin Islands. The commissioners will aim to impart their experiences and lessons from comparable and applicable regional settings on topics ranging from consensus-building, regulatory policy and system planning coordination, and other participatory models of regulation in order to demonstrate the value of a transparent and well-coordinated multi-stakeholder dialogue. The development of these components will lay a necessary foundation for the creation of an enabling environment to attract private sector capital, to restructure and reform the existing energy institutions, to decentralize energy service administration, and to fully utilize abundant regional energy resources.

title.narrative: Empowering ASEANs Efforts to Prevent and Combat Trafficking in Persons in Southeast Asia

description.narrative: This project will support ASEAN's efforts to prevent and combat trafficking in persons by strengthening ASEAN's capacity. The program has three objectives: 1.) strengthening ASEAN's capacity to address TIP in the region through the harmonization of laws among member states by encouraging Burma, Brunei, Malaysia, Singapore, and Vietnam to accede to the Palermo protocols and adoption of TIP language to match the Palermo protocol; 2.) build awareness, understanding, and capacity among government and law enforcement within ASEAN on TIP; and 3.) strengthen regional sharing of information and collaboration with an emphasis on standards of care for TIP victims.

description.narrative: Two regional workshops on maritime security and preventive diplomacy for the region soon to be run by The Asia Foundation. In alignment with State Department's support for fostering constructive engagement with and between member countries of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), The Asia Foundation will convene two substantive regional dialogue forums to discuss two issues of particular significance to the region and to U.S. foreign policy priorities: maritime security and the disaster management capacity of the ASEAN region. To be held in in Kuala Lumpur and Bangkok, respectively, these forums will serve as venues for senior government officials and distinguished specialists from think tanks, academia, and civil society institutions to discuss, debate, and provide recommendations on the regional dimensions of critical issues facing the ASEAN community. As a resource for future discussion and policy development, conference reports will be issued after each forum, which will present the substantive recommendations emerging from the discussions.

title.narrative: LMI Research and Educational Networks (RENS) Training

description.narrative: This workshop for the Lower Mekong nations has three focus areas: 1) forming and enhancing science and education collaborations among US scientists and scientists of the countries of the LMR; 2)developing human capacity to operate and maintain cyberinfrastructure in support of science and engineering collaborations; 3) policy, funding and regulatory best practices in cyberinfrastructure development and science collaboration. .The workshop will bring together operators and managers of Research and Education Networks (RENs) at the campus and national levels; researchers from institutions within the region and from the US who collaborate in three main areas of science and engineering: disaster management, climate change and forestry; and policy-makers and leaders from government and academia involved in supporting the development of cyberinfrastructure and collaborative science in their countries and in the region. .

title.narrative: Lower Mekong Initiative (LMI) Sustainable Infrastructure Partnership II (SIPII)

description.narrative: The goal of this program is to strengthen the ability of Lower Mekong governments, both at the working level and up through decision makers, to better understand and manage shared natural resources, improve joint planning and coordination, and deploy new technologies, approaches and methodologies concerning sustainable development, natural resources conservation and management. This program will also strengthen regional and national capacity to better access, manage and share data and analysis products to improve the management of natural resources and reduce the risks from natural disasters, such as floods and droughts.
